content.thinking: The user wants me to check tasks.md and report the number of incomplete tasks. If all complete, output 'ALL_COMPLETE', if there are remaining tasks, output 'REMAINING: N'.

content.content:
1â†’# Tasks: LOOP Macro Implementation
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/029-loop-macro/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: TDD mandatory per constitution (Principle VII). Tests MUST be written first and FAIL before implementation.
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’---
    17â†’
    18â†’## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)
    19â†’
    20â†’**Purpose**: Project initialization and LOOP macro infrastructure
    21â†’
    22â†’- [ ] T001 Define loop-context struct in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    23â†’- [ ] T002 Define loop-iteration-clause struct hierarchy in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    24â†’- [ ] T003 [P] Define loop-accumulation-clause struct in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    25â†’- [ ] T004 [P] Define loop-termination-clause struct in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    26â†’- [ ] T005 [P] Define loop-conditional-clause struct in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    27â†’- [ ] T006 Export LOOP symbol in src/clysm/package.lisp
    28â†’- [ ] T007 Create tests/unit/loop-test.lisp with rove test scaffold
    29â†’
    30â†’---
    31â†’
    32â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    33â†’
    34â†’**Purpose**: LOOP clause parser infrastructure that ALL user stories depend on
    35â†’
    36â†’**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete
    37â†’
    38â†’- [ ] T008 Implement parse-loop-clauses dispatcher in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    39â†’- [ ] T009 Implement loop-keyword-p predicate for LOOP keyword recognition in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    40â†’- [ ] T010 Implement make-loop-gensym for unique variable generation in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    41â†’- [ ] T011 Implement expand-loop main entry point (skeleton) in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    42â†’- [ ] T012 Register LOOP macro with (register-macro registry 'loop ...) in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    43â†’- [ ] T013 Create tests/contract/loop-wasm-test.lisp with Wasm validation scaffold
    44â†’- [ ] T014 [P] Create tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp with ANSI compliance scaffold
    45â†’
    46â†’**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    47â†’
    48â†’---
    49â†’
    50â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Basic Iteration with FOR/AS Clauses (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    51â†’
    52â†’**Goal**: Implement FOR/AS clauses for arithmetic, list, and vector iteration
    53â†’
    54â†’**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 collect i)` returns `(1 2 3)`
    55â†’
    56â†’### Tests for User Story 1 âš ï¸
    57â†’
    58â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    59â†’
    60â†’- [ ] T015 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR arithmetic parsing (from/to/by) in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    61â†’- [ ] T016 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR IN list parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    62â†’- [ ] T017 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR ON list parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    63â†’- [ ] T018 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR ACROSS vector parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    64â†’- [ ] T019 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR = THEN parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    65â†’- [ ] T020 [P] [US1] Contract test: FOR arithmetic expansion validates as Wasm in tests/contract/loop-wasm-test.lisp
    66â†’- [ ] T021 [P] [US1] Integration test: FOR from 1 to 10 executes correctly in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
    67â†’
    68â†’### Implementation for User Story 1
    69â†’
    70â†’- [ ] T022 [US1] Implement parse-for-arithmetic for FROM/TO/BELOW/ABOVE/DOWNTO/DOWNFROM/BY in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    71â†’- [ ] T023 [US1] Implement parse-for-in for IN list iteration in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    72â†’- [ ] T024 [US1] Implement parse-for-on for ON list iteration in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    73â†’- [ ] T025 [US1] Implement parse-for-across for ACROSS vector iteration in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    74â†’- [ ] T026 [US1] Implement parse-for-equals for = init THEN step in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    75â†’- [ ] T027 [US1] Implement generate-iteration-init for initializing iteration variables in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    76â†’- [ ] T028 [US1] Implement generate-iteration-step for stepping variables via psetq in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    77â†’- [ ] T029 [US1] Implement generate-iteration-test for termination conditions in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    78â†’- [ ] T030 [US1] Implement expand-loop-body with tagbody/go structure in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    79â†’
    80â†’**Checkpoint**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 do (print i))` should work
    81â†’
    82â†’---
    83â†’
    84â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Accumulation Clauses (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    85â†’
    86â†’**Goal**: Implement COLLECT, SUM, COUNT, MAXIMIZE, MINIMIZE, APPEND, NCONC
    87â†’
    88â†’**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 collect (* i i))` returns `(1 4 9)`
    89â†’
    90â†’### Tests for User Story 2 âš ï¸
    91â†’
    92â†’- [ ] T031 [P] [US2] Unit test for COLLECT parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    93â†’- [ ] T032 [P] [US2] Unit test for SUM parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    94â†’- [ ] T033 [P] [US2] Unit test for COUNT parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    95â†’- [ ] T034 [P] [US2] Unit test for MAXIMIZE/MINIMIZE parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    96â†’- [ ] T035 [P] [US2] Unit test for APPEND/NCONC parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    97â†’- [ ] T036 [P] [US2] Unit test for INTO keyword parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    98â†’- [ ] T037 [P] [US2] Unit test for conflicting accumulation error detection in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
    99â†’- [ ] T038 [US2] Integration test: COLLECT returns correct list in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   100â†’- [ ] T039 [US2] Integration test: SUM returns correct total in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   101â†’
   102â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
   103â†’
   104â†’- [ ] T040 [US2] Implement parse-accumulation-clause for all accumulation types in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   105â†’- [ ] T041 [US2] Implement validate-accumulations for conflict detection (FR-021) in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   106â†’- [ ] T042 [US2] Implement generate-accumulator-init with proper initial values in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   107â†’- [ ] T043 [US2] Implement generate-collect-update with tail-pointer technique in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   108â†’- [ ] T044 [US2] Implement generate-sum-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   109â†’- [ ] T045 [US2] Implement generate-count-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   110â†’- [ ] T046 [US2] Implement generate-maximize-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   111â†’- [ ] T047 [US2] Implement generate-minimize-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   112â†’- [ ] T048 [US2] Implement generate-append-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   113â†’- [ ] T049 [US2] Implement generate-nconc-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   114â†’- [ ] T050 [US2] Integrate accumulation into expand-loop-body return value in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   115â†’
   116â†’**Checkpoint**: `(loop for i from 1 to 5 sum i)` returns `15`
   117â†’
   118â†’---
   119â†’
   120â†’## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Termination and Control Clauses (Priority: P2)
   121â†’
   122â†’**Goal**: Implement WHILE, UNTIL, ALWAYS, NEVER, THEREIS, RETURN, LOOP-FINISH
   123â†’
   124â†’**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 until (> i 5) collect i)` returns `(1 2 3 4 5)`
   125â†’
   126â†’### Tests for User Story 3 âš ï¸
   127â†’
   128â†’- [ ] T051 [P] [US3] Unit test for WHILE parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   129â†’- [ ] T052 [P] [US3] Unit test for UNTIL parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   130â†’- [ ] T053 [P] [US3] Unit test for ALWAYS/NEVER/THEREIS parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   131â†’- [ ] T054 [P] [US3] Unit test for RETURN parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   132â†’- [ ] T055 [P] [US3] Unit test for LOOP-FINISH parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   133â†’- [ ] T056 [US3] Integration test: WHILE terminates correctly in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   134â†’- [ ] T057 [US3] Integration test: ALWAYS returns T or NIL in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   135â†’
   136â†’### Implementation for User Story 3
   137â†’
   138â†’- [ ] T058 [US3] Implement parse-termination-clause for WHILE/UNTIL in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   139â†’- [ ] T059 [US3] Implement parse-boolean-aggregation for ALWAYS/NEVER/THEREIS in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   140â†’- [ ] T060 [US3] Implement parse-return for RETURN clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   141â†’- [ ] T061 [US3] Implement generate-while-test in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   142â†’- [ ] T062 [US3] Implement generate-until-test in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   143â†’- [ ] T063 [US3] Implement generate-always with early NIL return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   144â†’- [ ] T064 [US3] Implement generate-never with early NIL return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   145â†’- [ ] T065 [US3] Implement generate-thereis with early value return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   146â†’- [ ] T066 [US3] Implement generate-return with block return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   147â†’- [ ] T067 [US3] Implement LOOP-FINISH as go to epilogue tag in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   148â†’
   149â†’**Checkpoint**: Boolean aggregation and early exit work correctly
   150â†’
   151â†’---
   152â†’
   153â†’## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Conditional Clauses (Priority: P2)
   154â†’
   155â†’**Goal**: Implement IF, WHEN, UNLESS with ELSE and AND chaining
   156â†’
   157â†’**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 5 when (oddp i) collect i)` returns `(1 3 5)`
   158â†’
   159â†’### Tests for User Story 4 âš ï¸
   160â†’
   161â†’- [ ] T068 [P] [US4] Unit test for IF/WHEN parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   162â†’- [ ] T069 [P] [US4] Unit test for UNLESS parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   163â†’- [ ] T070 [P] [US4] Unit test for ELSE clause parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   164â†’- [ ] T071 [P] [US4] Unit test for AND clause chaining in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   165â†’- [ ] T072 [US4] Integration test: WHEN filters correctly in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   166â†’
   167â†’### Implementation for User Story 4
   168â†’
   169â†’- [ ] T073 [US4] Implement parse-conditional-clause for IF/WHEN/UNLESS in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   170â†’- [ ] T074 [US4] Implement parse-conditional-scope for clause grouping until END in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   171â†’- [ ] T075 [US4] Implement parse-else-clause for ELSE branch in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   172â†’- [ ] T076 [US4] Implement parse-and-chain for AND clause combination in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   173â†’- [ ] T077 [US4] Implement generate-conditional expanding to if/when/unless in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   174â†’
   175â†’**Checkpoint**: Conditional accumulation works: `(loop for x in list when (evenp x) collect x)`
   176â†’
   177â†’---
   178â†’
   179â†’## Phase 7: User Story 5 - INITIALLY and FINALLY Clauses (Priority: P2)
   180â†’
   181â†’**Goal**: Implement INITIALLY for prologue and FINALLY for epilogue
   182â†’
   183â†’**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 finally (return 'done))` returns `DONE`
   184â†’
   185â†’### Tests for User Story 5 âš ï¸
   186â†’
   187â†’- [ ] T078 [P] [US5] Unit test for INITIALLY parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   188â†’- [ ] T079 [P] [US5] Unit test for FINALLY parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   189â†’- [ ] T080 [US5] Integration test: INITIALLY executes before first iteration in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   190â†’- [ ] T081 [US5] Integration test: FINALLY executes after normal termination in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   191â†’- [ ] T082 [US5] Integration test: RETURN skips FINALLY in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   192â†’
   193â†’### Implementation for User Story 5
   194â†’
   195â†’- [ ] T083 [US5] Implement parse-initially-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   196â†’- [ ] T084 [US5] Implement parse-finally-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   197â†’- [ ] T085 [US5] Add INITIALLY forms after variable bindings in expand-loop-body in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   198â†’- [ ] T086 [US5] Add FINALLY forms before result in expand-loop-body in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   199â†’- [ ] T087 [US5] Ensure RETURN bypasses FINALLY via direct block return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   200â†’
   201â†’**Checkpoint**: Prologue and epilogue execute at correct times
   202â†’
   203â†’---
   204â†’
   205â†’## Phase 8: User Story 6 - Variable Binding Clauses (Priority: P2)
   206â†’
   207â†’**Goal**: Implement WITH clause for local variable binding
   208â†’
   209â†’**Independent Test**: `(loop with x = 10 for i from 1 to 3 collect (+ x i))` returns `(11 12 13)`
   210â†’
   211â†’### Tests for User Story 6 âš ï¸
   212â†’
   213â†’- [ ] T088 [P] [US6] Unit test for WITH var = expr parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   214â†’- [ ] T089 [P] [US6] Unit test for WITH var (nil default) parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   215â†’- [ ] T090 [P] [US6] Unit test for WITH AND parallel binding parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   216â†’- [ ] T091 [US6] Integration test: WITH bindings available in body in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   217â†’
   218â†’### Implementation for User Story 6
   219â†’
   220â†’- [ ] T092 [US6] Implement parse-with-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   221â†’- [ ] T093 [US6] Implement parse-with-and for parallel binding with AND in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   222â†’- [ ] T094 [US6] Add WITH bindings to let wrapper in expand-loop-body in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   223â†’
   224â†’**Checkpoint**: WITH bindings work correctly with sequential and parallel modes
   225â†’
   226â†’---
   227â†’
   228â†’## Phase 9: User Story 7 - DO Clause for Side Effects (Priority: P3)
   229â†’
   230â†’**Goal**: Implement DO/DOING clause for side effect forms
   231â†’
   232â†’**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 do (print i))` prints 1 2 3
   233â†’
   234â†’### Tests for User Story 7 âš ï¸
   235â†’
   236â†’- [ ] T095 [P] [US7] Unit test for DO clause parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   237â†’- [ ] T096 [P] [US7] Unit test for DOING synonym parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   238â†’- [ ] T097 [US7] Integration test: DO executes each iteration in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   239â†’
   240â†’### Implementation for User Story 7
   241â†’
   242â†’- [ ] T098 [US7] Implement parse-do-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   243â†’- [ ] T099 [US7] Add DO forms to body generation in expand-loop-body in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   244â†’
   245â†’**Checkpoint**: Side effect forms execute correctly each iteration
   246â†’
   247â†’---
   248â†’
   249â†’## Phase 10: User Story 8 - Named Loops and RETURN-FROM (Priority: P3)
   250â†’
   251â†’**Goal**: Implement NAMED clause for block naming and nested loop exit
   252â†’
   253â†’**Independent Test**: Nested loop with `(return-from outer value)` exits correctly
   254â†’
   255â†’### Tests for User Story 8 âš ï¸
   256â†’
   257â†’- [ ] T100 [P] [US8] Unit test for NAMED clause parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   258â†’- [ ] T101 [US8] Integration test: NAMED establishes block in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   259â†’- [ ] T102 [US8] Integration test: RETURN-FROM exits named loop in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   260â†’
   261â†’### Implementation for User Story 8
   262â†’
   263â†’- [ ] T103 [US8] Implement parse-named-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   264â†’- [ ] T104 [US8] Use named block in expand-loop-body when NAMED present in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   265â†’- [ ] T105 [US8] Default block name is NIL when NAMED not present in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   266â†’
   267â†’**Checkpoint**: Named loops work with RETURN-FROM for nested loop exit
   268â†’
   269â†’---
   270â†’
   271â†’## Phase 11: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   272â†’
   273â†’**Purpose**: Improvements affecting multiple user stories
   274â†’
   275â†’- [ ] T106 [P] Add multiple FOR clause parallel stepping (psetq) in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   276â†’- [ ] T107 [P] Add AND keyword support for parallel FOR stepping in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   277â†’- [ ] T108 Add comprehensive error messages with source context in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   278â†’- [ ] T109 [P] Add edge case tests for empty iteration in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   279â†’- [ ] T110 [P] Add edge case tests for simple LOOP (infinite) in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
   280â†’- [ ] T111 Import ANSI LOOP tests from ansi-test/iteration/loop*.lsp to tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
   281â†’- [ ] T112 Run full test suite with nix flake check
   282â†’- [ ] T113 Verify at least 50 ANSI test cases pass (SC-005)
   283â†’
   284â†’---
   285â†’
   286â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   287â†’
   288â†’### Phase Dependencies
   289â†’
   290â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   291â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
   292â†’- **User Stories (Phase 3-10)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
   293â†’  - US1 + US2 are both P1 priority - core MVP
   294â†’  - US3-US6 are P2 priority - important features
   295â†’  - US7-US8 are P3 priority - advanced features
   296â†’- **Polish (Phase 11)**: Depends on US1-US8 being complete
   297â†’
   298â†’### User Story Dependencies
   299â†’
   300â†’- **User Story 1 (P1)**: FOR/AS iteration - foundational, no story dependencies
   301â†’- **User Story 2 (P1)**: Accumulation - uses US1 iteration, but independently testable
   302â†’- **User Story 3 (P2)**: Termination - uses US1 iteration, independently testable
   303â†’- **User Story 4 (P2)**: Conditionals - can wrap US2 accumulation, independently testable
   304â†’- **User Story 5 (P2)**: INITIALLY/FINALLY - uses loop structure, independently testable
   305â†’- **User Story 6 (P2)**: WITH bindings - uses loop structure, independently testable
   306â†’- **User Story 7 (P3)**: DO clause - uses loop structure, independently testable
   307â†’- **User Story 8 (P3)**: NAMED loops - wraps block naming, independently testable
   308â†’
   309â†’### Within Each User Story
   310â†’
   311â†’- Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD)
   312â†’- Parsing before code generation
   313â†’- Code generation before integration
   314â†’- Story complete before moving to next priority
   315â†’
   316â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   317â†’
   318â†’- T003, T004, T005 can run in parallel (different struct definitions)
   319â†’- T015-T021 (US1 tests) can all run in parallel
   320â†’- T031-T039 (US2 tests) can all run in parallel
   321â†’- T051-T057 (US3 tests) can all run in parallel
   322â†’- All [P] marked tasks within each phase can run in parallel
   323â†’
   324â†’---
   325â†’
   326â†’## Parallel Example: User Story 1
   327â†’
   328â†’```bash
   329â†’# Launch all US1 tests together:
   330â†’Task: "Unit test for FOR arithmetic parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
   331â†’Task: "Unit test for FOR IN list parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
   332â†’Task: "Unit test for FOR ON list parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
   333â†’Task: "Unit test for FOR ACROSS vector parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
   334â†’Task: "Unit test for FOR = THEN parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
   335â†’Task: "Contract test: FOR arithmetic expansion validates as Wasm"
   336â†’Task: "Integration test: FOR from 1 to 10 executes correctly"
   337â†’```
   338â†’
   339â†’---
   340â†’
   341â†’## Implementation Strategy
   342â†’
   343â†’### MVP First (User Stories 1 + 2 Only)
   344â†’
   345â†’1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
   346â†’2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
   347â†’3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (FOR/AS iteration)
   348â†’4. Complete Phase 4: User Story 2 (Accumulation)
   349â†’5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test `(loop for i from 1 to 10 collect (* i i))`
   350â†’6. MVP delivers core LOOP functionality
   351â†’
   352â†’### Incremental Delivery
   353â†’
   354â†’1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
   355â†’2. Add US1 (FOR/AS) â†’ Test â†’ Working iteration
   356â†’3. Add US2 (Accumulation) â†’ Test â†’ MVP complete!
   357â†’4. Add US3 (Termination) â†’ Test â†’ Better control flow
   358â†’5. Add US4 (Conditionals) â†’ Test â†’ Filtering capability
   359â†’6. Add US5-US8 â†’ Test â†’ Full LOOP implementation
   360â†’7. Polish â†’ 50+ ANSI tests passing
   361â†’
   362â†’---
   363â†’
   364â†’## Notes
   365â†’
   366â†’- [P] tasks = different files or no dependencies
   367â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story
   368â†’- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
   369â†’- TDD required: Verify tests fail before implementing
   370â†’- Commit after each task or logical group
   371â†’- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
   372â†’- Hash-table iteration (BEING THE HASH-KEYS OF) deferred per research.md
   373â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: LOOP Macro Implementation

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/029-loop-macro/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md

**Tests**: TDD mandatory per constitution (Principle VII). Tests MUST be written first and FAIL before implementation.

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

**Purpose**: Project initialization and LOOP macro infrastructure

- [ ] T001 Define loop-context struct in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T002 Define loop-iteration-clause struct hierarchy in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T003 [P] Define loop-accumulation-clause struct in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T004 [P] Define loop-termination-clause struct in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T005 [P] Define loop-conditional-clause struct in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T006 Export LOOP symbol in src/clysm/package.lisp
- [ ] T007 Create tests/unit/loop-test.lisp with rove test scaffold

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: LOOP clause parser infrastructure that ALL user stories depend on

**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

- [ ] T008 Implement parse-loop-clauses dispatcher in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T009 Implement loop-keyword-p predicate for LOOP keyword recognition in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T010 Implement make-loop-gensym for unique variable generation in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T011 Implement expand-loop main entry point (skeleton) in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T012 Register LOOP macro with (register-macro registry 'loop ...) in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T013 Create tests/contract/loop-wasm-test.lisp with Wasm validation scaffold
- [ ] T014 [P] Create tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp with ANSI compliance scaffold

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Basic Iteration with FOR/AS Clauses (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: Implement FOR/AS clauses for arithmetic, list, and vector iteration

**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 collect i)` returns `(1 2 3)`

### Tests for User Story 1 âš ï¸

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T015 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR arithmetic parsing (from/to/by) in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T016 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR IN list parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T017 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR ON list parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T018 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR ACROSS vector parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T019 [P] [US1] Unit test for FOR = THEN parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T020 [P] [US1] Contract test: FOR arithmetic expansion validates as Wasm in tests/contract/loop-wasm-test.lisp
- [ ] T021 [P] [US1] Integration test: FOR from 1 to 10 executes correctly in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T022 [US1] Implement parse-for-arithmetic for FROM/TO/BELOW/ABOVE/DOWNTO/DOWNFROM/BY in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T023 [US1] Implement parse-for-in for IN list iteration in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T024 [US1] Implement parse-for-on for ON list iteration in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T025 [US1] Implement parse-for-across for ACROSS vector iteration in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T026 [US1] Implement parse-for-equals for = init THEN step in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T027 [US1] Implement generate-iteration-init for initializing iteration variables in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T028 [US1] Implement generate-iteration-step for stepping variables via psetq in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T029 [US1] Implement generate-iteration-test for termination conditions in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T030 [US1] Implement expand-loop-body with tagbody/go structure in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 do (print i))` should work

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Accumulation Clauses (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: Implement COLLECT, SUM, COUNT, MAXIMIZE, MINIMIZE, APPEND, NCONC

**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 collect (* i i))` returns `(1 4 9)`

### Tests for User Story 2 âš ï¸

- [ ] T031 [P] [US2] Unit test for COLLECT parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T032 [P] [US2] Unit test for SUM parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T033 [P] [US2] Unit test for COUNT parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T034 [P] [US2] Unit test for MAXIMIZE/MINIMIZE parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T035 [P] [US2] Unit test for APPEND/NCONC parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T036 [P] [US2] Unit test for INTO keyword parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T037 [P] [US2] Unit test for conflicting accumulation error detection in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T038 [US2] Integration test: COLLECT returns correct list in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T039 [US2] Integration test: SUM returns correct total in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T040 [US2] Implement parse-accumulation-clause for all accumulation types in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T041 [US2] Implement validate-accumulations for conflict detection (FR-021) in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T042 [US2] Implement generate-accumulator-init with proper initial values in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T043 [US2] Implement generate-collect-update with tail-pointer technique in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T044 [US2] Implement generate-sum-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T045 [US2] Implement generate-count-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T046 [US2] Implement generate-maximize-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T047 [US2] Implement generate-minimize-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T048 [US2] Implement generate-append-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T049 [US2] Implement generate-nconc-update in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T050 [US2] Integrate accumulation into expand-loop-body return value in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: `(loop for i from 1 to 5 sum i)` returns `15`

---

## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Termination and Control Clauses (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement WHILE, UNTIL, ALWAYS, NEVER, THEREIS, RETURN, LOOP-FINISH

**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 until (> i 5) collect i)` returns `(1 2 3 4 5)`

### Tests for User Story 3 âš ï¸

- [ ] T051 [P] [US3] Unit test for WHILE parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T052 [P] [US3] Unit test for UNTIL parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T053 [P] [US3] Unit test for ALWAYS/NEVER/THEREIS parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T054 [P] [US3] Unit test for RETURN parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T055 [P] [US3] Unit test for LOOP-FINISH parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T056 [US3] Integration test: WHILE terminates correctly in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T057 [US3] Integration test: ALWAYS returns T or NIL in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [ ] T058 [US3] Implement parse-termination-clause for WHILE/UNTIL in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T059 [US3] Implement parse-boolean-aggregation for ALWAYS/NEVER/THEREIS in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T060 [US3] Implement parse-return for RETURN clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T061 [US3] Implement generate-while-test in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T062 [US3] Implement generate-until-test in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T063 [US3] Implement generate-always with early NIL return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T064 [US3] Implement generate-never with early NIL return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T065 [US3] Implement generate-thereis with early value return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T066 [US3] Implement generate-return with block return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T067 [US3] Implement LOOP-FINISH as go to epilogue tag in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Boolean aggregation and early exit work correctly

---

## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Conditional Clauses (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement IF, WHEN, UNLESS with ELSE and AND chaining

**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 5 when (oddp i) collect i)` returns `(1 3 5)`

### Tests for User Story 4 âš ï¸

- [ ] T068 [P] [US4] Unit test for IF/WHEN parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T069 [P] [US4] Unit test for UNLESS parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T070 [P] [US4] Unit test for ELSE clause parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T071 [P] [US4] Unit test for AND clause chaining in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T072 [US4] Integration test: WHEN filters correctly in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 4

- [ ] T073 [US4] Implement parse-conditional-clause for IF/WHEN/UNLESS in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T074 [US4] Implement parse-conditional-scope for clause grouping until END in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T075 [US4] Implement parse-else-clause for ELSE branch in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T076 [US4] Implement parse-and-chain for AND clause combination in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T077 [US4] Implement generate-conditional expanding to if/when/unless in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Conditional accumulation works: `(loop for x in list when (evenp x) collect x)`

---

## Phase 7: User Story 5 - INITIALLY and FINALLY Clauses (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement INITIALLY for prologue and FINALLY for epilogue

**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 finally (return 'done))` returns `DONE`

### Tests for User Story 5 âš ï¸

- [ ] T078 [P] [US5] Unit test for INITIALLY parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T079 [P] [US5] Unit test for FINALLY parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T080 [US5] Integration test: INITIALLY executes before first iteration in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T081 [US5] Integration test: FINALLY executes after normal termination in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T082 [US5] Integration test: RETURN skips FINALLY in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 5

- [ ] T083 [US5] Implement parse-initially-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T084 [US5] Implement parse-finally-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T085 [US5] Add INITIALLY forms after variable bindings in expand-loop-body in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T086 [US5] Add FINALLY forms before result in expand-loop-body in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T087 [US5] Ensure RETURN bypasses FINALLY via direct block return in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Prologue and epilogue execute at correct times

---

## Phase 8: User Story 6 - Variable Binding Clauses (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement WITH clause for local variable binding

**Independent Test**: `(loop with x = 10 for i from 1 to 3 collect (+ x i))` returns `(11 12 13)`

### Tests for User Story 6 âš ï¸

- [ ] T088 [P] [US6] Unit test for WITH var = expr parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T089 [P] [US6] Unit test for WITH var (nil default) parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T090 [P] [US6] Unit test for WITH AND parallel binding parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T091 [US6] Integration test: WITH bindings available in body in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 6

- [ ] T092 [US6] Implement parse-with-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T093 [US6] Implement parse-with-and for parallel binding with AND in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T094 [US6] Add WITH bindings to let wrapper in expand-loop-body in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: WITH bindings work correctly with sequential and parallel modes

---

## Phase 9: User Story 7 - DO Clause for Side Effects (Priority: P3)

**Goal**: Implement DO/DOING clause for side effect forms

**Independent Test**: `(loop for i from 1 to 3 do (print i))` prints 1 2 3

### Tests for User Story 7 âš ï¸

- [ ] T095 [P] [US7] Unit test for DO clause parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T096 [P] [US7] Unit test for DOING synonym parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T097 [US7] Integration test: DO executes each iteration in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 7

- [ ] T098 [US7] Implement parse-do-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T099 [US7] Add DO forms to body generation in expand-loop-body in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Side effect forms execute correctly each iteration

---

## Phase 10: User Story 8 - Named Loops and RETURN-FROM (Priority: P3)

**Goal**: Implement NAMED clause for block naming and nested loop exit

**Independent Test**: Nested loop with `(return-from outer value)` exits correctly

### Tests for User Story 8 âš ï¸

- [ ] T100 [P] [US8] Unit test for NAMED clause parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T101 [US8] Integration test: NAMED establishes block in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T102 [US8] Integration test: RETURN-FROM exits named loop in tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 8

- [ ] T103 [US8] Implement parse-named-clause in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T104 [US8] Use named block in expand-loop-body when NAMED present in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T105 [US8] Default block name is NIL when NAMED not present in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Named loops work with RETURN-FROM for nested loop exit

---

## Phase 11: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Improvements affecting multiple user stories

- [ ] T106 [P] Add multiple FOR clause parallel stepping (psetq) in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T107 [P] Add AND keyword support for parallel FOR stepping in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T108 Add comprehensive error messages with source context in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T109 [P] Add edge case tests for empty iteration in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T110 [P] Add edge case tests for simple LOOP (infinite) in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp
- [ ] T111 Import ANSI LOOP tests from ansi-test/iteration/loop*.lsp to tests/integration/loop-ansi-test.lisp
- [ ] T112 Run full test suite with nix flake check
- [ ] T113 Verify at least 50 ANSI test cases pass (SC-005)

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
- **User Stories (Phase 3-10)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
  - US1 + US2 are both P1 priority - core MVP
  - US3-US6 are P2 priority - important features
  - US7-US8 are P3 priority - advanced features
- **Polish (Phase 11)**: Depends on US1-US8 being complete

### User Story Dependencies

- **User Story 1 (P1)**: FOR/AS iteration - foundational, no story dependencies
- **User Story 2 (P1)**: Accumulation - uses US1 iteration, but independently testable
- **User Story 3 (P2)**: Termination - uses US1 iteration, independently testable
- **User Story 4 (P2)**: Conditionals - can wrap US2 accumulation, independently testable
- **User Story 5 (P2)**: INITIALLY/FINALLY - uses loop structure, independently testable
- **User Story 6 (P2)**: WITH bindings - uses loop structure, independently testable
- **User Story 7 (P3)**: DO clause - uses loop structure, independently testable
- **User Story 8 (P3)**: NAMED loops - wraps block naming, independently testable

### Within Each User Story

- Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD)
- Parsing before code generation
- Code generation before integration
- Story complete before moving to next priority

### Parallel Opportunities

- T003, T004, T005 can run in parallel (different struct definitions)
- T015-T021 (US1 tests) can all run in parallel
- T031-T039 (US2 tests) can all run in parallel
- T051-T057 (US3 tests) can all run in parallel
- All [P] marked tasks within each phase can run in parallel

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1

```bash
# Launch all US1 tests together:
Task: "Unit test for FOR arithmetic parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for FOR IN list parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for FOR ON list parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for FOR ACROSS vector parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for FOR = THEN parsing in tests/unit/loop-test.lisp"
Task: "Contract test: FOR arithmetic expansion validates as Wasm"
Task: "Integration test: FOR from 1 to 10 executes correctly"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Stories 1 + 2 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (FOR/AS iteration)
4. Complete Phase 4: User Story 2 (Accumulation)
5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test `(loop for i from 1 to 10 collect (* i i))`
6. MVP delivers core LOOP functionality

### Incremental Delivery

1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
2. Add US1 (FOR/AS) â†’ Test â†’ Working iteration
3. Add US2 (Accumulation) â†’ Test â†’ MVP complete!
4. Add US3 (Termination) â†’ Test â†’ Better control flow
5. Add US4 (Conditionals) â†’ Test â†’ Filtering capability
6. Add US5-US8 â†’ Test â†’ Full LOOP implementation
7. Polish â†’ 50+ ANSI tests passing

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files or no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story
- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
- TDD required: Verify tests fail before implementing
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
- Hash-table iteration (BEING THE HASH-KEYS OF) deferred per research.md
